meanings.definition: A former gold coin of various European countries.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people used ducats to buy goods and services.
meanings.sent2: She saved up her ducats to purchase a beautiful necklace.
meanings.sent3: The pirate's treasure chest was overflowing with shiny ducats.
meanings.sent4: His smile was worth more than a chest full of ducats.
meanings.sent5: The ducats gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of wealth and power.

meanings.sent1: He worked hard to earn enough ducats to buy a new bicycle.
meanings.sent2: The beggar on the street asked for some spare ducats.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, along with a handful of ducats.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like music, more valuable than any amount of ducats.
meanings.sent5: The ducats jingled in his pocket, a reminder of his financial security.
